DCL Headers

Send comments on this topic.
These headers are the standard files that OEMs need to use either when building DCL aware applications or when porting DCL to a new operating system.

Summary

dcl.h   The top-level DCL header for internal DCL code which is built by the standard build process.
dclconf.h   The master DCL project configuration header.
dcl_wince.h   The master DCL header file for code which is built outside the standard DCL build process, but uses DCL functionality.
dlosconf.h   The master DCL configuration header for a given OS.

dcl.h

The top-level DCL header for internal DCL code which is built by the standard build process. This header is automatically included by any master product header such as flashfx.h or reliance.h. For DCL specific code which needs this header, it should be the first Datalight header included, after any OS specific headers.

Normally OEMs do not need to include this header at all, unless they are modifying DCL to support a new OS.

dclconf.h

The master DCL project configuration header. This header file resides in each DCL Project Directory, and is automatically included by dcl.h.

When a new project is created, a template dclconf.h file is copied from the \dcl\os\wince\newproj directory.

See the section DCL Project Configuration Settings for information on the contents of this file.

Note that the default template header may be different for each the various operating systems which DCL supports, so mixing copies from different operating system abstractions is not recommended.

dcl_wince.h

The master DCL header file for code which is built outside the standard DCL build process, but uses DCL functionality. This header is automatically included by any master product header, such as flashfx_wince.h or reliance_wince.h.

If this header is used independently by code which is calling DCL functionality, but is built outside the Datalight standard build process, this header is typically included first, before any other Datalight headers, and after any OS specific headers.

To use this, the \dcl\include directory should be in the include search path.

dlosconf.h

The master DCL configuration header for a given OS. This header file resides in the \dcl\os\wince\include directory, and defines the characteristics of the OS abstraction. This header is automatically included by dcl.h.

This file does NOT need to be modified in most cases, or even directly included, however those OEMs who are porting DCL to support a new environment will need to modify this file.
